page.title: 02QUEEN VICTORIA SCHOOL(EDUC)
page.content: During the first half century the education of the boys tended to be more practical than academic with a view to the boys entering the boys service (although this was not compulsory).This period was supervised by the Royal Army Education Corps, however, with the raising of the school leaving age the academic side became more important. To accommodate this increase in academic work the teaching staff changed over to civilian teachers. Subjects being taught are english, mathematics, statistics, latin, french, german, modern studies, economics, physics, chemistry, biology, art, woodwork, metalwork, technical drawing, engineering, physical edn., music, piping, drumming, highland dancing and soon computing.
